meanings.definition: The quality of being deceptive or misleading.
meanings.sent1: The fallaciousnesses of the advertisement misled many customers.
meanings.sent2: The report was full of fallaciousnesses, making it hard to trust.
meanings.sent3: The magician's fallaciousnesses made the audience believe in magic tricks.
meanings.sent4: The fallaciousnesses of the mirage deceived the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The fallaciousnesses of the rumor spread like wildfire in the small town.

meanings.definition: The state of containing false or misleading information.
meanings.sent1: The fallaciousnesses in the document were discovered during the investigation.
meanings.sent2: The website was shut down due to its fallaciousnesses.
meanings.sent3: The fallaciousnesses in the story made it more interesting to read.
meanings.sent4: The fallaciousnesses of the map led the explorers astray.
meanings.sent5: The fallaciousnesses in the contract were revealed in court.
